key_points: Gen. Colin Powell, retired general and former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, praises Veterans of Desert Storm.
Powell recalls the dedication and readiness of young service members during Operation Desert Shield and Desert Storm.
He emphasizes the sense of family among the troops and their commitment to their mission.
Powell recounts heartwarming and humorous moments with soldiers during his visits downrange.
He highlights President George H.W. Bush's cautious approach to avoid war and seek a political solution first.
Powell's doctrine, advocating for war as a last resort and the strategic use of military force, played a pivotal role.
He discusses the effective use of airpower at the beginning of the conflict to soften the battlefield.
Powell outlines the strategic operations of the ground war and the swift success of the U.S. and coalition forces.
The use of advanced technology and media coverage during Desert Storm significantly impacted American public perception.
Powell acknowledges the crucial roles of logisticians, Merchant Marines, and air transportation in the success of Desert Storm.
spokespersons: Gen. Colin Powell (Retired General, former Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff)
